website_summaries.verdict: Keeping the feet feeling good and well supported, the Merrell Siren Edge Waterproof had received loads of good feedback. Furthermore, its vibrant color and feminine style had buyers persuaded. On the flipside, many disliked its construction quality and the waterproof promise that didn’t deliver. In a nutshell, this footwear is widely recommended to neophyte trailblazers who value comfort more than anything else. However, amidst the comfort, style and its diverse functionality, this shoe would not be the best wear for serious trails.
pros: The Merrell Siren Edge Waterproof received tons of compliments because of its comfortable in-shoe feel
Many wearers appreciated this shoe’s ample and correct arch support
This shoe was was made marketable by its color and style

They mentioned that it was sturdy enough to provide stability as they hiked
This shoe required zero break in
It immediately felt nice wearing the shoe straight out of the box, as said by some buyers
cons: Numerous Merrell Siren Edge Waterproof owners observed that the shoe wore out easily, especially at the edges
They mentioned that it was supposedly a great shoe, but it did not last long

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these trainers in April 2017. At first I thought they were great. Comfortable and waterproof, however, the waterproof seal has now split and if I walk on wet grass, my feet get soaked. I really don't think it worth £70 for a product that fails within 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Fifi

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money

Terrible, this is all what I can say about these shoes. Don't buy them! I'm really dissapointed. And in pictures you can see my boots after 3 weeks of moderate (10-15km per day in Englands weather) wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiva

customer_reviews.title: Smart
customer_reviews.text: Having read other reviews after ordering these, I've left off reviewing these for a couple of months. A couple of months of rain, hail and snow, during which I've worn them nearly every day. They have been absolutely fine, no leaks, and they're smart enough for wearing to work. I did get a blister the first day I wore them, but to be fair, I walked a long way that day and I do have tragically fragile skin - so I'm not marking them down any stars for that.

customer_reviews.title: sub standard

Have had other Merrell trainers and shoes that have lasted for years so am pretty disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, let's hope they last!

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, very comfortable

Merrell trainers have become my go-to footwear preference and these trainers are no exception. They are very light and comfortable and the fit is excellent. There is good support for the foot arch and the look fairly stylist too (I got black). They say they are waterproof but I haven't tried them out yet in a torrential downpour.
customer_reviews.author: fenniet

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but disapointing
customer_reviews.text: Very light and comfortable, but if they ever started off as waterproof, it didn't last long. As others found, they split between the fabric and the sole. I wasn't sure if this was because I'd over-tighted them or because I do walk more to the outside after an ankle injury, but reading other reviews, perhaps it's all in the manufacturing. I went with 2 stars because despite of this I've has a lot of comfortable, if slightly soggy, wear out of them and only stopped wearing them when it was very noticeable.

customer_reviews.title: Best walking shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrills shoes. They run a 1/2 size small so I get size 7 , I'm usually a 61/2. I don't wear leather because I'm a vegetarian and Merrillls do a vegan shoe. I wore Merrills when I did a post round and they are the most comfortable shoes I ever wore on the job. You can take them out of the box and wear them on a 20 mile hike, with no breaking in. Highlly recommended .

I would not be able to walk miles in them without discomfort, so they will be kept for walking around the shops and strolls with the dog. I will try another brand to see if they will fit any better.

product_meta.title: Merrell Women's Siren Edge Waterproof Low Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: These Siren Edge Waterproof shoes from Merrell feature mesh and 3D print mesh upper along with breathable mesh lining. M Select dry impermeable membrane seals out water and lets moisture escape. Merrell air cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability.
